objection_handling.objection: Your quote is much higher than your competitor's.
talking_points: I understand price is an important factor. Can I ask what was included in their quote?
Our quote includes premium materials that last 30% longer than standard materials
We include a comprehensive 20-year warranty covering both materials and labor
All our installers are certified and fully insured, which protects your investment
avoid: Immediately offering to match price without explaining value

objection_handling.objection: I want to wait until next year to replace my roof.
objection_handling.response_strategy: Educate on risks of delay, offer inspection
talking_points: I completely understand wanting to plan major expenses. May I ask what's driving the decision to wait?
Even minor roof damage can lead to significant interior water damage over time
Repair costs typically increase 15-25% when issues are left unaddressed
We offer a free comprehensive inspection to determine if waiting is a safe option

sales_scenarios.customer_profile: New to home maintenance, budget-conscious, concerned about making the right choice
key_points: Explain process step-by-step to build confidence
Offer good-better-best options with clear differences

sample_dialogues.situation: Initial phone inquiry about roof leak

dialogue.customer: Hi, I think I might have a leak in my roof. There's a water stain on my ceiling.
dialogue.response: I'm sorry to hear that. Water stains can definitely be concerning. To help you best, could you tell me a bit more about when you first noticed it and if it's appeared after recent rainfall?

dialogue.customer: I just noticed it yesterday after the storm we had.
dialogue.response: That timing does suggest it could be related to your roof. One thing we can do is schedule a free inspection to identify exactly where the water is coming in and assess any damage. We have availability this week - would you prefer morning or afternoon?

dialogue.customer: I'd need to check my schedule first. How much would a repair typically cost?
dialogue.response: I understand wanting to know about costs upfront. Repair costs vary widely depending on the source and extent of the leak - it could be as simple as replacing a few shingles ($300-500) or might indicate a larger issue. The good news is our inspection is completely free with no obligation, and we'll provide a detailed estimate before any work begins. We can also check if this might be covered by your homeowner's insurance.
